zone.line: from my cottage; the grass was being mowed,
and there was the scent of hay in the 124
fields; all the earth look fresh and its
inhabitants happy. Evening approached
and I beheld the sun set. I haeed Three years
ago and on that day and hour it shone
through the leaves branches of and leaves
of the beech wood and its beams flickered
upon the countenance of him whom I then
beheld for the last time. I now saw that
divine orb, gilding all the clouds with un
wonted splendour, sink behind the horizon;
he it disappeared from a world where
he whom I would seek exists not; it ap
proached a world where he exists not; Why
do I weep so bitterly;? Why my does my
heart heave with vain endeavour to
cast al aside the bitter anguish that
covers it "as the waters cover the sea."
I go from this world where he is no longer
and soon I shall meet him in another.
Farewell, Woodville; the turf will soon
